Wildlife & Nature.name: Ivory & Antlers: A Safari of Facts
Wildlife & Nature.description: Test your knowledge of animal anatomy and unusual facts! This quiz explores everything from elephant tusks to the camelopard, challenging your understanding of the animal kingdom.

questions.text: Elephant tusks are made of what material?
questions.hint: This material is also used in piano keys and is valued for its durability.

questions.text: What is another name for the camelopard?
questions.hint: This animal’s long neck and spots make it unmistakable in the savanna.

questions.text: What animal is used to make lard?
questions.hint: This animal’s fat is rendered to produce a cooking fat used in baking.

questions.text: Which of these animals lays eggs?
questions.hint: This animal is an amphibian, unlike the others, which are mammals.

Wildlife & Nature.name: Fin-tastic Fauna: Aquatic & Avian Adventures
Wildlife & Nature.description: Dive into the world of fish and birds with this challenging quiz! From ichthyologists to Australian avians, prepare to explore the diverse ecosystems of our planet.

questions.text: What is the technical term for someone who studies fish?
questions.hint: The root of this word comes from the Greek for fish, ‘ichthys.’

questions.text: Which of these household pets should be vaccinated for parvovirus?
questions.hint: This pet is a common canine companion, susceptible to this viral disease.

questions.text: Which of these Australian birds is most closely related to the ostrich?
questions.hint: This flightless bird is a large, native Australian species.

questions.text: According to folklore, the 'jackalope' is an antlered version of what animal?
questions.hint: This creature is a small, hopping mammal often found in North American tall tales.

questions.text: Which of these snakes is poisonous?
questions.hint: This snake’s name suggests a metallic hue and is a venomous pit viper.

questions.text: Which of these plants is the national emblem of Scotland?
questions.hint: This prickly plant is a symbol of resilience in Scottish culture.

questions.text: What animal represents the year 2000 on the Chinese calendar?
questions.hint: This mythical creature is a powerful symbol of strength and good fortune.

questions.text: What kind of animal is a peregrine?
questions.hint: This creature is known for its incredible speed, especially when diving.

Wildlife & Nature.name: Cartoon Critters & Curious Customs
Wildlife & Nature.description: From Tennessee Tuxedo to sacred Indian animals, this quiz explores the intersection of pop culture and wildlife.  Test your knowledge of animal representations and cultural significance.

questions.text: What kind of animal is cartoon character Tennessee Tuxedo?
questions.hint: This character wears a bow tie and lives in a cold environment.

questions.text: Which of these sounds is commonly associated with owls?
questions.hint: This sound is a distinctive nighttime call, often heard in forests.

questions.text: How many eyes does a Giraffe have?
questions.hint: Like most mammals, this animal has the standard number of eyes for binocular vision.

questions.text: What animal is considered sacred in India?
questions.hint: This animal is revered in Hinduism and often roams freely in villages.

questions.text: Which of these animals shares its name with a luxury car?
questions.hint: This animal’s name is synonymous with a sleek, British car brand.

Wildlife & Nature.name: Fleece, Foals & Fantastic Habitats
Wildlife & Nature.description: Explore the world of animal products, hybrid offspring, and preferred habitats! This quiz covers everything from mohair to jackalopes, challenging your understanding of animal biology and folklore.

questions.text: Mohair is made from the fleece of what animal?
questions.hint: This animal is known for its soft, lustrous wool, often used in luxury fabrics.

questions.text: What is the technical term for the offspring of a female donkey and a male horse?
questions.hint: This hybrid’s name is less common than its reverse, a mule.

questions.text: What animal is used to make lard?
questions.hint: This animal’s fat is rendered to produce a cooking fat used in baking.

questions.text: Which of these household pets should be vaccinated for parvovirus?
questions.hint: This pet is a common canine companion, susceptible to this viral disease.

questions.text: Which of these animals shares its name with a luxury car?
questions.hint: This animal’s name is synonymous with a sleek, British car brand.

questions.text: According to folklore, the 'jackalope' is an antlered version of what animal?
questions.hint: This creature is a small, hopping mammal often found in North American tall tales.

questions.text: What animal represents the year 2000 on the Chinese calendar?
questions.hint: This mythical creature is a powerful symbol of strength and good fortune.

questions.text: Which of these sounds is commonly associated with owls?
questions.hint: This sound is a distinctive nighttime call, often heard in forests.

questions.text: Which of these plants is the national emblem of Scotland?
questions.hint: This prickly plant is a symbol of resilience in Scottish culture.

Wildlife & Nature.description: A mix of animal products, anatomy, and reproduction! This quiz covers a wide range of topics, from the fleece of a mohair goat to the egg-laying habits of certain animals.
